review_blob: One of the best beer surprises Ive had in a while, as I ordered this at a restaurant having never heard of the brewer. I had a bottle, which poured a nice orangish amber with white head that lingered for a while. The smeel is trong, clean hops. The flavor is much smoother than the full-on hop assault I expected. Im a confirmed hophead, but the balance and subtlety of this beer were truly surprising. It finishes clean with a very nice hoppy aftertaste. Would make an excellent session beer. This compares favorably with a Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, for example, though I suspect price differences might make that comparison useless. Good stuff.

For some reason, I had decent expectations for this, because certain friends talked it up so much. They are fools, and this is crap. Its on a level with Original Coors, just barely above Bud Light. "Bock" my ass - theres no flavor whatsoever. Is this what passes for beer in Texas?

On draft at lunch today. Appearance is the best part of this brew - a lovely black that lets very little light through, capped by an inch of off-white head. Aroma is nuts and alcohol. Has a good feeling in the mouth, but the flavor lacks punch. You get caramel, nuts, and smoke. Not bad, but everything comes on too weak, and there arent enough layers "coming on" to begin with. Disappointing.

Its a great thing that this beer is starting to become more widely available in bars, restaurants, etc. in my area. Its not my favorite beer, by far, but its a very passable pale ale. Decent hoppiness to it, but not overpowering (sometimes, I like overpowering!). The  Its a very moderate brew in most respects, so it makes a great session beer. For that reason, its become my go-to brew. When my unenlightened friends are drinking Bud Light, I drink this.

Nice reddish/brownish color with persistent head, leaves a pretty lacing on the glass. Smells strong, pungent, wonderful, tastes even better. Starts off as a sharp hoppy bitterness on the tip of the tongue, finishes as a deeper bitterness cut with a slight malty/earthy sweetness that you barely notice. Too many hints of flavor to count. Every drink leaves me wanting more. I did this as my first rating because its probably my favorite brew right now.
